titleproper.value: Guide to the Neil Polen Photographs <num>MSS.090</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Fales Staff, with description by Weatherly Stephan and Jennifer Gargiulo

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2017-07-25T18:54:48</date>

abstract.value: Neil F. Polen (1945-1997) was a New York City bookseller and photographer. The Neil Polen Photographs include contact sheets, negatives, and prints by Polen dating from 1978 to 1991. The majority of the photographs in the collection were taken in the downtown neighborhoods of New York City, with some photographs in Albany, N.Y., and Haiti. In addition to individual portraits, the photographs depict architecture and cityscapes in New York City.

p.value: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/> Identification of item, date (if known); Neil Polen Papers; MSS 090; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

Neil F. Polen (1945-1997) was a New York City bookseller and photographer. Polen was born in Albany, N.Y. on January 1, 1945. Between January 11, 1962 and March 5, 1964 he was a Seaman in the United States Navy. Polen died in Miami, FL on May 25, 1997. He is buried in Mishkan Tefilah Cemetery in West Roxbury, MA.
The collection does not include any biographical information about Polen, literature by or about him, or  information about gallery showings of his work.

subject.value: Street photography |z New York (State) |z New York
